name: Team Standup Meeting
transcript:
Manager: Alright, let's get started with our daily standup. Who wants to go first?

Developer One: I'll go. Yesterday I finished the authentication refactor. Today I'm starting on the API rate limiting feature. No blockers.

Manager: Great progress. Developer Two?

Developer Two: I'm still working on the database migration. Ran into an issue with the foreign key constraints. I might need some help from Developer One later today.

Developer One: Yeah, just ping me when you're ready. I dealt with similar issues last sprint.

Manager: Perfect. What about the QA side?

QA Lead: We finished testing the new export feature. Found three bugs, all minor UI issues. I've already filed them and assigned them to Developer One.

Developer One: I saw those. I should be able to knock them out this afternoon.

Manager: Excellent. Any other concerns before we wrap up?

Developer Two: Just one thing. The staging environment has been slow lately. Can we look into that?

Manager: Good point. I'll create a ticket for DevOps to investigate. Anything else? No? Alright, let's have a productive day everyone.
